page.title: 13HOUSING.
page.content: Most of the houses in our survey area are made of stone. This is because they are quite old, about a hundred years approximately. Ochiltree Castle is the oldest building, it has one part that was built in 1540. This makes it four hundred and forty_five years old. There have been additions to it since then. There are, however, some modern houses scattered over the countryside. Some of these are very modern bungalows that are attached to the farms, possibly for married sons or daughters, other houses were built about fifty years ago for the water-board employees. These houses are not particularly attractive. In some places there have been stone cottages, now derelict.
